abilitygroupdescription.p: Evocation involves the unsophisticated use of raw magic powers.

abilitydescription.p: The caster shoots a raw stream of thaumic energy from their hands at a target. If successful the target may make a Dodge, agility, or speed check to avoid the stream.

If the stream hits the target the target suffers d6 damage and is pushed 30'10m away from the caster. If the caster hits and a benefit occurs roll on the overcharge effects table and apply the result to the target. The caster can choose whether or not to apply the overcharge effect to the target or to control the magical energies and supress the result.
The caster uses a raw stream of thaumic energy to grab a target crushing it and pulling it towards him. If successful the target may make a Dodge, agility, or speed check to avoid the stream.

If the stream hits the target the target suffers d6 damage and is pulled 30'10m towards the caster. If the caster hits and a benefit occurs roll on the overcharge effects table and apply the result to the target. The caster can choose whether or not to apply the overcharge effect to the target or to control the magical energies and supress the result.
Incendo allows the caster to create fire by heating the air.

leveldescription.p: Creates a fire of torch intensity.
Allows the user to make a weapon flame for the duration of a combat. Flaming weapons do +d6 extra fire damage.

abilitydescription.p: The character can view events from the past. Viewing events in the future is incredibly difficult and unreliable (See Scry, Greater).

The caster first names a target then checks to see whether the spell succeeds. If it does, they see an important scene from targets life (the GM narrates the scene to the player). The caster may then choose to look far forward, forward, back or far back in time. Each time the player attempts to view another scene from the targets life they make another check with their remaining magic pool against a DC 10. The caster may continue to view scenes from the targets life until they fail or choose to stop scrying.

Contagion is very important to this spell. A good contagious link, the targets blood, or hair for example, can reduce the difficulty of this spell by 10! If the caster fails any checks while scrying their contagious link is destroyed.

abilitylevel.effect: The caster views scences from the targets past.
The caster views scences from the targets past.

abilitydescription.p: The character can view events from a targets present and their future as well as their past. This spell works like the lesser Scry but because the future is not predetermined the results are often very unreliable and inaccurate.

abilitylevel.effect: The caster views scences from the targets past, present or future.
The caster views scences from the targets past, present or future

abilitydescription.p: The caster grabs an opponent. On success the caster acts as a conduit to one of the dread planes, life is drained from the target. Anything that increases contagion will increase damage for this spell. The target is momentarily transfixed (checks Will versus the casters successful magic roll or loses their turn).

abilitylevel.effect: Target saves versus Willpower or suffers 2d8 damage. On overcharge the caster suffers 1d8 damage.
Target saves versus Willpower or suffers 3d8 damage. On overcharge the caster suffers 1d12 damage.
